definition: to decrease/to lose/to damage/to harm/(coll.) to speak sarcastically/to deride/caustic/mean/one of the 64 hexagrams of the Book of Changes (䷨)

sentences.english: I think my friend is hanging out with the wrong crowd and I'm concerned about her safety.
sentences.chinese: 我覺得我的朋友正和損友來往，我很擔心她的安全。

sentences.english: Yet most people would say that a real friend is more than just a fair weather friend.
sentences.chinese: 但是大多數人會說一個真正的朋友比一個損友要更多。

sentences.english: To earn the appreciation of honest critics and endure the betrayal of false friends.
sentences.chinese: 博得真誠評論者的認可，容忍損友的背叛。

sentences.english: What's hydrogen's best friend in this case?
sentences.chinese: 此時，氫原子最佳損友是誰？
那就是我所謂的“食物損友”。

sentences.english: Avoid the D's as much as possible throughout the day.
sentences.chinese: 在一天當中儘可能地不與損友接觸。

sentences.english: We should keep the bad friends at arm's length.
sentences.chinese: 對那些損友，我們就應該與他們保持距離。

definition: to turn a blind eye to/to ignore
to gesticulate/to point out/to point the finger of blame
to submit to humiliation (idiom); to suffer in silence/to swallow one's anger/to grin and bear it
